definition: inseparable (as form and shadow)
to appear/to look/form/shape
picture/image/film/movie/photograph/reflection/shadow/trace
(negative prefix)/not/no
mythical beast (archaic)
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
surname Li

sentences.english: After spending two years together, they are now inseparable.
sentences.chinese: 两年的相处让他们如今形影不离。

sentences.english: The two friends cling together wherever they go.
sentences.chinese: 这两个朋友不论走到哪里都形影不离。

sentences.english: We are all with together, the whole day mean like potatos and carrot.
sentences.chinese: 我们俩形影不离，整天就像土豆和胡萝卜一样。

sentences.english: Wei Wei did that by herself when she was young. Language is always useful.
sentences.chinese: 难免，韦唯每次演出他总是形影不离的处理很多工作。

sentences.english: So lice have been with us since the world's first clothes were made.
sentences.chinese: 在世界第一件衣服出现后虱子也就和我们形影不离了。

sentences.english: China and the UK have also been working closely on a global scale.
sentences.chinese: 中英在国际事务中近年也是“形影不离”。

sentences.english: Look at this pair, always together.
My friend and I are beginning to be known as a twosome.
sentences.chinese: 我和朋友形影不离，大家都知道。

sentences.english: And the President got to keep his precious BlackBerry.
sentences.chinese: 总统更是和他心爱的黑莓手机形影不离。

sentences.english: "White Tiger" and I got to know each, they will become inseparable friends.
sentences.chinese: “白虎”和我混熟之后，便成了形影不离的好朋友。

sentences.english: I am always here to plan with you.
sentences.chinese: 我总是形影不离，与你计议前程。

sentences.english: Later, they decided to be sworn brothers and became more intimate than before .
sentences.chinese: 后来，两人结拜为兄弟，更是时时刻刻，形影不离。

sentences.english: Miyuki and the dog gradually learn to accept each other, and soon become inseparable.
sentences.chinese: 美雪与小狗逐渐学会接受对方，并很快变得形影不离。

sentences.english: Doris and Flora are inseparable. They're like two peas in a pod.
sentences.chinese: 多丽丝和弗洛拉两个形影不离，如胶似漆。

sentences.english: The 46-day-old calf now follows her wherever she goes.
sentences.chinese: 现在，46天大的牛犊和白形影不离。

definition: lit. body and shadow follow each other (idiom)/fig. inseparable
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
to follow sb closely (idiom)/to keep close to
not to hold anything back (idiom)/(of close friends etc) to tell each other everything
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
good friend/(slang) a visit from Aunt Flo (menstrual period)
conjoined twins
intimate friendship/bosom buddies
to be estranged
as close as one's hands and feet (idiom); loving one another as brothers/deep friendship/closely attached to one another
to be kind and love one another (idiom); bound by deep emotions
lit. green plums and hobby-horse (idiom)/fig. innocent children's games/childhood sweethearts/a couple who grew up as childhood friends
coming and going alone (idiom); a lone operator/keeping to oneself/unsociable/maverick
mutually dependent for life (idiom); to rely upon one another for survival/interdependent
conjoined twins/Siamese twins
playmate
